items.title: Domestic Abuse Killings Climb as Murders Drop, Frustrating New York Officials
items.abstract: The persistence of such killings has frustrated the police, prosecutors and social service providers struggling to prevent intimate tensions that play out behind closed doors from turning deadly.

items.title: Times Minute | Art Galleries in the City
items.abstract: Today on the Minute, a look at art galleries across New York City.

items.title: Review: Thomas Adès Calls for Complexity at City Center
items.abstract: An ambitious program of four Adès scores, each accompanied with a dance by a different choreographer.

items.title: Textiles Designed With Warp, Woof and Wit at MoMA
items.abstract: The exhibition “Taking a Thread for a Walk” reveals the museum’s underappreciated collection of fiber art and industrial design.
keywords: Taking a Thread for a Walk (Exhibit)

items.title: Pandemic Shows New York Is Too Quick to Split Families, Advocates Say
items.abstract: When fewer children were taken into foster care during lockdown in 2020, child abuse did not appear to rise.
